Translation of 楚竹書・王居持書(en) into English.

p.seg: The king was in his palace at Su Man.
Peng Tu returned to Yangguan to fulfill the order (of the king)
and Lü Chang made a report on his behalf.
The king had not yet answered him,
and Guan Wuwei [WJ1] took hold of the document and said:
“He (Peng Tu) is one the most brutal and tyrannical people of the state of Chu.
With his treacherous words
(he could) bring about the demise of the king (?).
As for the words of an official,
if they not only do not get punished,
but he (can) instead even come back to serve the king,
what will the people say about it?”
I have heard that the good ministers of ancient times
would not enter the royal gates with their own private favors and enmities.
beside for what you report to me,
I cannot see and hear beyond the walls (of the royal palace)
I consider you as my eyes and ears at a distance,
but you not only are unable to judge on my behalf,
only choosing what my relatives approve
and considering people of no talent as worthies,
but you are not even able to use discretion in the way to punish people,
thereby getting involved in calumny and mutual slander.
Too many times you have caused me to be at fault with the people of the country.
I want to punish you.
The people of the country say
that I am unable to judge men,
that I promote somebody and a moment later I get rid of him,
and this all my own fault [because I trusted your poor judgment].
From now on I will not act like this anymore.
Even though you are my favorite,
you are not as important as the survival of the state.
You must be very careful.
The day after, prime minister Zichun approached [the king].
The king came close to him and said:
"Now, Pengtu has always made strenuous efforts for me (?),
I should promote him (?).
The prime minister assented,
(but) asked to wait until the completion (of Peng Tu’s duties in Yangguan).
The king said:
“I want to proceed more speedily.
The prime minister agreed
(but) ordered to wait for the next promotion (?).
The king approached him (again) and said:
“Wu wei damaged and alienated him.
This is already known to the multitude.
The people of the state are deeply discouraged,
and say that I am unable to judge (the value of people (?)).
Pengtu is extremely able in promoting the less prominent people.
He does not want the officials to turn their back (on me).
So he will diminish my blame.
